citations.narrative:
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) as prescribed. The PVC prescribes for the use of injectable
Ivermectin to be given orally to adult dogs once per month for the prevention of heartworm disease. The licensee told the
inspector that they have been using the pour-on Ivermectin instead. The inspector called and spoke with the Attending
Veterinarian (AV) who states he does not endorse the use of pour-on Ivermectin. Heartworm disease is a parasitic
infection spread by mosquitos. Affected dogs may be asymptomatic, or may have coughing, lethargy, or exercise
intolerance. Correct by ensuring that sampling and treatment of parasites, including heartworm disease, be performed in
accordance with a schedule and plan approved by the AV. Correct by: September 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) as prescribed. The PVC prescribes for the use of injectable 
Ivermectin to be given orally to adult dogs once per month for the prevention of heartworm disease. The licensee told the 
inspector that they have been using the pour-on Ivermectin instead. The inspector called and spoke with the Attending 
Veterinarian (AV) who states he does not endorse the use of pour-on Ivermectin. Heartworm disease is a parasitic 
infection spread by mosquitos. Affected dogs may be asymptomatic, or may have coughing, lethargy, or exercise 
intolerance. Correct by ensuring that sampling and treatment of parasites, including heartworm disease, be performed in 
accordance with a schedule and plan approved by the AV. Correct by: September 1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
